On the weapons of mass destruction that never surfaced despite being cited by the President Bush administration as the primary justification for the war, Donald Rumsfeld acknowledged: My goodness, the intelligence was certainly wrong. But he categorically refused to say whether he would have acted differently had he known then what he knows now about Saddam Hussein 's alleged weapons.

In a posting on his blog Zahi Hawass said the incident at the museum resulted in 70 broken objects, all of which can be restored. `` I want people to know that after nine days of protests, the monuments are safe,'' Zahi Hawass said.`` If anything happens, I will announce it.'' The 51-year-old congressman's future has been the subject of speculation since he resigned the No. 3 GOP House leadership slot after easily winning in November for a sixth term from his eastern Indiana district. I am convinced he is now going to run for governor, said Mike McDaniel , a former state Republican chairman.
